How the CLI uses collections

Collections extend the “configuration surface” of the CLI: they add profiles and agents (and sometimes domain context) that the CLI can discover and load. After a collection is installed, its profiles can be selected just like bundled profiles.

What changes after installing a collection

  • More profiles show up in amplifier profile list.
  • More agents show up in chat (often with a collection prefix).
  • The new profiles may reference additional modules/sources.

What does not change automatically

  • Your active profile stays the same until you switch.
  • Installed collections don’t “run”; they provide content/config to be selected.

Practical workflow

# install
amplifier collection add git+https://github.com/microsoft/amplifier-collection-toolkit@main

# see what it added
amplifier profile list

# use it
amplifier profile use toolkit-dev

Concrete implementation points (amplifier-app-cli)

  • Collection install/list/update commands: amplifier_app_cli/commands/collection.py
  • Collection discovery/paths resolver: amplifier_app_cli/paths.py
  • Bundled collections shipped inside the app: amplifier_app_cli/data/collections/
